api.title: API Documentation

restApi.description: Comprehensive HTTP API for validating and analyzing business ideas programmatically.

websockets.title: Websocket API
websockets.description: Real-time interaction for continuous analysis and updates during the validation process.

documentation.title: Getting Started
documentation.description: To get started with the Startupideia API, you'll need to register for an API key through your account dashboard. Once you have your API key, you can make authenticated requests to our endpoints.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: All API requests must include your API key for authentication. We use OAuth 2.0 for secure access to our API resources.

endpoints.title: Available Endpoints
endpoints.description: Our API provides several endpoints to interact with our idea validation system:
endpoints.getIdeas: Retrieve all your previously analyzed ideas
endpoints.analyzeIdea: Submit a new idea for analysis
endpoints.getIdeaById: Get detailed information about a specific idea
endpoints.getReports: Retrieve generated reports for your ideas

blog.title: Latest Insights & Trends
blog.subtitle: Explore our latest articles on entrepreneurship, idea validation, and market trends
blog.submitCasePromo: Have a success story? Submit your startup case study for our blog.

post1.title: 5 Key Metrics to Validate Your Business Idea
post1.excerpt: Learn which data points matter most when determining if your idea has market potential.
post1.content: When validating a business idea, there are several metrics that can help you determine whether your concept has potential to succeed in the market. These metrics include market size, customer acquisition cost, lifetime value of customers, profit margins, and growth potential. By analyzing these key indicators, entrepreneurs can make informed decisions before investing significant resources.

post2.title: How to Create an MVP That Actually Tests Your Hypothesis
post2.excerpt: Building the right minimum viable product can save you months of development time.
post2.content: A minimum viable product (MVP) should be designed with a clear hypothesis in mind. Rather than focusing on features, concentrate on what specific assumption you need to validate. Keep your MVP lean, measure the right metrics, and be prepared to pivot based on user feedback. This approach will save you time and resources while providing valuable insights into your idea's viability.

post3.title: Finding Your Niche: When Smaller Markets Mean Bigger Profits
post3.excerpt: Why targeting a narrower audience can lead to stronger market positioning and better returns.
post3.content: Counterintuitively, targeting a smaller, more specific market segment can often lead to greater success for startups. Niche markets typically have less competition, more specialized needs, and customers who are willing to pay premium prices for solutions tailored to their specific problems. This approach allows you to establish yourself as an expert and build a loyal customer base before considering expansion.

post4.title: The Entrepreneur's Guide to Angel Investment in Angola
post4.excerpt: How to attract early-stage investment for your startup in the growing Angolan market.
post4.content: Angola's startup ecosystem is evolving rapidly, with more angel investors looking for promising ventures. To attract this capital, entrepreneurs need to understand local investor expectations, regulatory environment, and networking opportunities. This guide explores the Angolan investment landscape and provides practical tips for securing early-stage funding in this emerging market.

post5.title: Technology Trends Reshaping African Startups in 2025
post5.excerpt: The innovations and technologies creating new opportunities for entrepreneurs across the continent.
post5.content: From mobile payment solutions to sustainable energy technologies, several key innovations are creating unprecedented opportunities for African entrepreneurs. This article examines how these technologies are solving uniquely African challenges while creating scalable business models that have potential for global expansion. We highlight success stories from various regions and sectors.

post6.title: From Idea to Market: The Journey of DMK's Startup Platform
post6.excerpt: An inside look at how Startupideia was developed and launched in Angola.
post6.content: In this exclusive case study, we share the development journey of Startupideia, from initial concept to market launch. Founder Marciairo Kumbuessa discusses the challenges faced as a solo developer building a tech startup in Angola, and how the platform evolved based on local entrepreneur needs and feedback from early users.

aboutUs.title: Our Mission
aboutUs.subtitle: We're on a mission to help entrepreneurs validate their business ideas and increase their chances of success

mission.title: Why We Started
mission.description1: Startupideia was founded by Marciairo Kumbuessa, a solo developer with a vision to make business idea validation accessible to entrepreneurs in Angola and beyond. After experiencing firsthand the challenges of launching businesses without proper validation, he created Startupideia to solve this critical problem.
mission.description2: Today, DMK, Lda is helping entrepreneurs across Angola make data-driven decisions about their business ideas before investing significant resources.
